content.raw:
I installed gazebo5-prerelease and when running, I see some errors.

In the same console that I used to launch gazebo:

```
Error [parser.cc:528] Unable to find uri[model://apl_description]
[libprotobuf ERROR google/protobuf/message_lite.cc:123] Can't parse message of type "gazebo.msgs.Model" because it is missing required fields: name
hx_update() Service call timed out.
hx_update() Service call timed out.
hx_update() Service call timed out.
hx_update() Service call timed out.
hx_update() Service call timed out.
hx_update() Service call timed out.
hx_update() Service call timed out.
```

In the client log:
```
(1418873783 868367354) [Msg] Waiting for master.
(1418873783 874188597) [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
(1418873783 874924557) [Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.0.198

(1418873790 883218441) [Wrn] [gazebo.cc:186] Waited 1seconds for namespaces.

(1418873792 885480093) [Wrn] [gazebo.cc:186] Waited 1seconds for namespaces.
(1418873793 886295627) [Wrn] [gazebo.cc:186] Waited 1seconds for namespaces.
(1418873794 887541873) [Err] [gazebo.cc:191] Waited 11 seconds for namespaces. Giving up.
(1418873796 467031057) [Err] [Node.cc:98] No namespace found

...
(1418873860 72807879) [Dbg] [HaptixGUIPlugin.cc:937] waiting for polhemus to pause (max wait 3 sec).
```

The gazebo screen with the arat world appears anyway. Is this only happening on my computer?

content.raw:
I think it's fine to make the package a plain cmake package. Eliminates a ROS dependency.

Note for posterity: for development, I think the `catkin_make_isolated` instructions are still valid, even though they are removed by this pull request. I personally find them useful for building lots of packages from source.
content.html:
I think it's fine to make the package a plain cmake package. Eliminates a ROS dependency.

Note for posterity: for development, I think the catkin_make_isolated instructions are still valid, even though they are removed by this pull request. I personally find them useful for building lots of packages from source.

pull_request.title: Change to a default CMake build

pullrequest.title: Change to a default CMake build

content.raw:
Three reasons for this change:

1. It was the only package related to HAPTIX that requires catkin.

1. The HAPTIX project does not need ROS.

1. This format follows what we use for sdformat, and all the ignition projects.

And yes, ideally we'd get this in before the next release.
content.html:
Three reasons for this change:

  1. It was the only package related to HAPTIX that requires catkin.

  2. The HAPTIX project does not need ROS.

  3. This format follows what we use for sdformat, and all the ignition projects.

And yes, ideally we'd get this in before the next release.

content.raw:
I don't have a strong position about catkin/no-catkin in our packages. Which work best for all of you is fine. However it affects to the release process, so we want probably this in before a new release, right?

//cc @scpeters, just to be sure that this is fine for you too.
content.html:
I don't have a strong position about catkin/no-catkin in our packages. Which work best for all of you is fine. However it affects to the release process, so we want probably this in before a new release, right?

//cc @scpeters, just to be sure that this is fine for you too.

content.raw: Handsim proprietary is going away. Until it does, you can just copy the `apl_description` into `~/.gazebo/models`.

pull_request.title: Change to a default CMake build

pullrequest.title: Change to a default CMake build

content.raw: wow, nice refactoring! However, handsim-proprietary is also a catkin package, which makes it convenient to build both handsim and handsim-proprietary using catkin. It appears to me that on this branch, in order to install handsim from source, you still have to catkin_make handsim-proprietary (which is now in its own catkin workspace, since handsim is no longer catkin) and source the install files in the catkin workspace, creating an extra step for the user. Are you planning on migrating handsim-proprietary to a default CMake build as well, and including it in handsim using cmake? Or should I just suck it up and write a script for myself to source all the necessary files?
content.html: wow, nice refactoring! However, handsim-proprietary is also a catkin package, which makes it convenient to build both handsim and handsim-proprietary using catkin. It appears to me that on this branch, in order to install handsim from source, you still have to catkin_make handsim-proprietary (which is now in its own catkin workspace, since handsim is no longer catkin) and source the install files in the catkin workspace, creating an extra step for the user. Are you planning on migrating handsim-proprietary to a default CMake build as well, and including it in handsim using cmake? Or should I just suck it up and write a script for myself to source all the necessary files?
